reviews.text: Excellent service and a warm atmosphere. Highly recommend!

This place is the king of Mexican restaurants in the community . The ambiance on the outside and inside is invigorating. And the fish tacos and beef is amazing . The right about of lightning inside and a feel of inside dining when if you choose to dine outside.
A great place to spend time with friends or family.
Beautiful setting and welcoming people. I‚Äôll definitely come back!
Excellent service and a warm atmosphere. Highly recommend!
This place has always been impressive. Food is great, staff is great. 10/10

Can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs taken me so long to write this gem a review. Chavela‚Äôs is such a Brooklyn treasure. We have never had a mediocre meal. Everything from the mainstays to the specials are delicious and made with heart. Their margaritas are also incredible. Highly recommend the mole. The service is always warm and friendly. Another plus is that the fun atmosphere could definitely warrant a more dressy date night, but many people also go completely casual and we have felt comfortable doing so as well. If there was only one restaurant I was able to recommend to a traveler to Brooklyn, it would be Chavela‚Äôs. Nothing compares!

My friend and I dine in with our kids and we had a great time. The food was amazing. The drinks were great. The atmosphere was a breath of fresh air. We enjoyed our stay. It was so great that my boyfriend and I along with our daughter went too. We had an awesome time. We enjoyed our food. He was amazed with the food , drinks and prices. It is definitely a top pick for me.
I recommend
Carnitas in the Molcajete, yum. Juicy, flovorful, not greasy. Superior little tortillas.
Food was super delicious
Even on a busy night, I got sat and got my food so fast. I sat at 7:56 and got my food at 8:06. Amazing service as always
One of our family‚Äôs favorite brunch spots in brooklyn
Great Latin feel right in the middle of an aspiring new crown heights
Great discovery in this neighbourhood! Really good Mexican food, margaritas and el Diablos cocktails were great. The decoration is beautiful. Server was very gentle.

I had an amazing experience at this Mexican restaurant! The service was warm, friendly, and attentive, making me feel welcomed from the moment I walked in. The atmosphere was vibrant and inviting, with lively music playing in the background‚Ä¶

As soon as we sat down to dine in the server that was appointed to us already served us water, sliver wear, etc. Wonderful painting all around the restaurant which made the place have a very unique style. One bite into the food made my whole night while being surrounded with my family. Respectful employees, clean establishment, 5 star food, refreshing beverages. Overall would come back to try out more food.

As soon as me and my family came to dine in I was already flabbergasted by the ascetic of the restaurant. Amazing authentic music being played every minute, wonderful service always checking up on your table making sure everything is okay, finally the greatest part was the food. I would 110% recommend trying out this restaurant.
Excellent food, exciting and innovative twists on classic dishes.

Best part of the restaurant is the atmosphere, the negroni was a 10 but the labios rojos is a regular mezcalita, a basic drink just a beautiful presentation. The food was real basic mexican food, because of the fame I was expecting a little more. I give the food a 5. We had chilaquiles, tostadas, huarache, esquites and Plato don. Dont have any of them maybe other plates are better. We also had bread pudding it was a 4. Music was good and our server great!
Love this place!!!
The food is really delicious and very authentically Mexican. The interior design makes it feel very cozy
The service was amazing this places has a great team that works together!! My bro the loved the food
I'm pretty sure they change chefs because they changed the menu but the food was so hot we could not eat it. And lacking flavor. Not the chavelas of old.

Great tacos and really lovely service at an affordable price. The space itself is really gorgeous and the staff was attentive and kind. Loved the food, especially their guacamole- it was citrusy, chunky, and packing a good punch. Loved the vegetarian options, though choices were a bit limited. The nopales con frijoles taco was great. Definitely would go back!

Corn tortillas were a little dry, flavors a little bland, horchata too sweet. I really liked their red salsa and would recommend trying their salsa trio!

Service was just ok as our waitress had an amazingly positive attitude, but the hostess offered one group the bar to wait for their entire group to arrive while she blatantly told me I can‚Äôt be seated until my whole party arrives ü§î
Great tacos. I had a half sangria half margarita drink that was good.
Refreshing cocktails, kind staff, and authentic food. All was good, thanks.

Popped in to pick up an item from someone and didn‚Äôt want to drink or eat a large meal so I got dessert. The tres leches seemed appealing and it was! Really nice portion and it was light and satisfying. Always passed by Chavelas and would like to visit again for their other items
I love their food. It's well seasoned and some of them are really spicy. I go here often. If you plan on going after 6pm it's best to make reservations.
I'm a Trinidadian by birth, so I love spices and fresh green seasoning in my food. The food was okay, the boys loved it.

A favorite spot in the neighborhood with great food and drinks. Cute, artistic interiors (always makes me think of Harmony in Red & the Red Studio lol).

The space gets a little crowded during peak hours and there is often a wait, so I recommend getting there a little earlier to put your name down. But the staff are accommodating and the manager goes above and beyond to make sure you‚Äôre happy and cared for.
Gorgeous interior. Delicious and generous portions. Wide array of mezcal, tequila, sotol, and raicilla.

Great neighborhood gem! I‚Äôve visited here a few times for happy hour and the margaritas are strong. The food is really good and the overall ambiance is beautifully rustic. The decor feeds into the vibe which I really enjoyed. Some favorites were the steak and pork tacos, esquite and choco-flan! Amazing!
Drinks are excellent here!
Delicious food, great drinks, and fast service. Love it.
I don‚Äôt understand the reviews. Margaritas, enchiladas, tacos, and guacamole were all pretty average.

Everything I've tried was delicious. Guacamole was very tasty.
My drinks were refreshing and outstanding.
Service was absolutely AMAZING !!!!
Out server was nice and professional. We felt like special guests there.
I will definitely come back.

OSHA violation. Music dangerously loud. 91db on average. Way higher than OSHA allows for the period of time it takes to dine there.  Takeout only if you value your hearing. Obviously this is a tactic the owner is using to drive table turnover so that people don't longer and enjoy their meal. Too bad. The food and beverages are on point but the loudness of the ambience kills the whole thing.
Very nice yummmy
Great Food Fun Atmosphere !

Not great for a few reasons!

If you pay attention, most (maybe all?) of their meats are stewed or pulled or are prepared so that when an order comes in, they can grab the premade meat, combine it with a tortilla or another vehicle, and turn the  ticket around quickly. This drives a huge lack in quality and in texture. Comparing it to other tacos in the neighborhood where proteins are cooked on a flat top during prep, it‚Äôs hard to compare.

The piece above also means most of your food is drippy or soggy. Again, a textureless and subpar experience.

This feels like a place that had its glory days some years ago and now just makes big batch proteins that they can quickly flip tables and make money.

It‚Äôs mid and expensive. Go to Guero‚Äôs or even Nacho Macho is a better pick for Mexican in the neighborhood.
my fav restaurant in brooklyn every dish is phenomenal and anytime someone is in town i take them here
Great food! Great ambiance, great service.
Loved the food, and the margaritas were delicious. Great energy ‚ù§Ô∏è
This place is quite popular, but the service is pretty fast and wait time is reasonable even when crowded
The chicken rings and mole are chefs kiss!
Just unpretentious, delicious Mexican with nice outdoor seating, LOVED it !

Came to for a girls day with my friends and toddler. I was a little nervous at first, but the staff went above and beyond. The drinks were amazing and so was the food. We have not designated this "our spot" which means we will be back very soon. We look forward to trying new items on the menu.
Great drinks, food and service. A guaranteed good time!

A nice elevated Mexican neighborhood restaurant in the crown heights / prospect heights area. As we walked in, this place immediately got a line out the door, it gets packed on the weekends!

The food was solid. The Plato don Carne was quite good, the chicken imo was better than the steak. The enchiladas mariscos was okay. The shrimp and crabmeat were good. Salmon was an odd choice for a filling. Mole was standard mole, nothing too insane. The pozole was one of the better pozoles I‚Äôve had. The ceviche was fresh and delicious! Salsas were fine and the guacamole was fresh.

Overall, I think I would come back and try some different stuff.

Chavela's is a lovely restaurant which checks many of the boxes. The servers were professional and excellent. The food was quick in coming and tasted amazing. The music in the background was loud enough to hear but not drown conversations. Went on a Sunday around noon, the place was busy but thankfully as a party of two we did not have to wait. I recommend Chavela's.

The food we ordered was disappointing. We love Mexican food & I have made multiple trips to Mexico, but this food was blah. The Huevos Rancheros were inedible, and the tacos also tasted off. The best things were the guacamole & homemade tortilla chips, and the quesadillas, but even these were just okay, not great, just okay. Also, the food was overpriced for the area and what you get. Perhaps this place used to be better, or this was an off day. We‚Äôve eaten much better Mexican food in the East Village, our neighborhood.

On our way out we noticed they have a ‚ÄúB‚Äù sanitary rating, this may explain part of the problem. The plates & glasses were a bit dirty.

Some of the best Mexican food I‚Äôve had in NYC. Of course it doesn‚Äôt compare w CDMX or LA BUT the food is fresh, the restaurant‚Äôs ambiance is lively and fashionable, the service is fast and friendly. Definitely recommend- the cactus and mushroom tacos are veggie friendly and amazing!! Also loved the margarita pitcher
Deliciosos chilaquiles aut√©nticos, me sent√≠ en Mexico. Muy buena agua de jamaica. Excelente servicio muy recomendable. La ensalada de nopales no me encant√≥.

The food was ok, but it was missing the authentic Mexican flavors. I read the reviews, and it was mentioned that ‚Äúthis is the best Mexican food in the city.‚Äù‚Ä¶‚Ä¶I guess people don‚Äôt get out much.
The biggest disappointment was the churros; I was distraught. I am an eat dessert first kind of gal, but if I had eaten these churros first, I would have left right after. There was NO crunch, and the middle was oily and soft, two things that are big no-nos when we are talking about churros. I could have cried on the spot, and no, I‚Äôm not being dramatic; dessert is my thing. Check out my review before this one if uou want to try an amazing Mexican restaurant, they are my favorite, from start to finish! üôåüèæ

As for service, I felt rushed. When I put down my fork, they grabbed it IMMEDIATELY. I didn‚Äôt get the ‚Äúhey stay have another drink vibe,‚Äù instead it‚Äôs been 30 minutes you had ONE drink and some food, byeeeee.
It's not the place where I want to have a pitcher of sangria and hang out. I won't be back.

Spanish restaurant offering delicious food and great service. Had the flank steak, it was perfectly cooked, tender, and juicy. The avocado salsa verde paired well for flavoring. The Sopa Azteca is a must try, it‚Äôs so flavorful, bursting with rich, vibrant spices. Greta dining experience!

- Yo NYC+ how we doing?!

I‚Äôm back w/ another review, on this evening joined by my partner we celebrate our anniversary at a completely new restaurant to us, spontaneous much.

This place had an energetic vibe to it off the  jump, we definitely did not reserve b/c we didn‚Äôt think that far ahead but we highly recommend it! It‚Äôs very lively & we were met w/ a short line & a 10 min wait time for a walk in(honestly great turnover rate).

The staff was super generous & flowed like water through the night; super attentive & helpful. The food was absolutely flavorful & good portions for the price ! The drinks were well balanced & crafted w/ love & the desserts topped off the sequence perfectly!

Pay these folks a visit on your free time if you in the area, ya heard?!
Chavela‚Äôs is a 100/10!!!  Came here for a day early Mother‚Äôs Day dinner for mom and we were very happy with every thing.  Highly recommended!

Chavela‚Äôs is hands down one of my favorite/one of the most consistent/one of the best restaurants/Mexican restaurants in NYC! Each time I visit, I am more than impressed! Nothing compares to real, genuine, authentic Mexican flavors. Chef Arturo certainly knows his roots and you taste it in the cuisine.

I‚Äôd really like to talk about their chicken mole...girl....this is THEE chicken mole to try. If you‚Äôve never had chicken mole, do yourself a favor and start with Chavela‚Äôs. They offer the standard for what chicken mole should be! First off, there‚Äôs literally chocolate in the sauce. I‚Äôve had it at restaurants, where they overdo it with the chocolate. There should be a hint of it. You should know it‚Äôs there, but it should never be an overbearing note of chocolate. The mole sauce at Chavela‚Äôs is to die for! It‚Äôs rich and homey, and spews Mexican flavors! I mean, every time I get it, I eat it slowly, in order to enjoy the ride that it takes me on. Aside from the mole sauce itself, the chicken is always PERFECTLY cooked! So tender and never over cooked.

I‚Äôd also like to make mention of their margaritas. There‚Äôs margaritas, then there‚Äôs real, authentic margaritas. That‚Äôs what Chavela‚Äôs offers. There are layers of flavor in their margs. They are always consistently delicious. And salt around the rim is a must! Their guacamole is house made, ALWAYS, and you taste it every time, in every bite. Nice, chunky, yet creamy, guacamole. It‚Äôs served with their house made tortillas!

Everything I‚Äôve ordered here, has been made with love. It‚Äôs an ingredient, and I say it all the time. When there‚Äôs love in a dish, I taste it right away. Much love to Chavela‚Äôs.
fantastic drinks food was delicious and staff was friendly. What else could you ask for? Must try the margaritas!

Excellent food and atmosphere. Really high quality Mexican food with great staff. The guacamole is served in a traditional lava bowl with house made tortilla ‚Äòchips‚Äô and the tacos are next level. Neighborhood gem. Highly recommended.

Exactly the best Mexican Restaurant in New York, maybe in United States!! Tacos is good, tortillias are good, cocktails are also amazing. If you want to eat tasty and not gonna leave one million dollars in the restaurant, it is the best choice. Some pics of the food also)

5/5 for the mole and the homemade conchas. As for the atmosphere, it‚Äôs colorful and lively, the staff is happy to be there and they demonstrate it with their warmth and friendliness.

Now the food was not Mexico City standards, but it was probably the best Mexican food anywhere on this side of Brooklyn. I highly recommend the chicken mole which has a velvety chocolate and nutty taste.

So happy to have discovered  Chavelas last night. Met up with a friend for dinner and was warmly greeted at the door by the hostess.  The decor, lighting and music (overall vibe) made me feel instantly happy to be there. It's walk-in only but was fortunate to get a table at 6:15 because the place was full (on a Monday night) when we left. Alan, our server was wonderful and took great care of us. The spicy margarita was delicious and actually very spicy, which I appreciated. We absolutely loved the special short rib tacos and empanadas. So flavorful. We shared the Aurelia's mole and enjoyed the flavors but thought the chicken was a bit dry. That's the only slight criticism we had. Absolutely recommend this restaurant and I look forward to my next visit.

This was my first time and when I left, I could not stop talking about this place. ABSOLUTELY delish!! The atmosphere is beautiful, I went with a friend but it can definitely make for a nice date night! I had a variety of fish and shrimp tacos, chips with guacamole, and a really strong margarita! Can't wait to go again once I'm back in NY!!

One of the best experiences I have had in NYC. Food was exquisite, staff and service were 10/10, drinks were amazing and everything was very very well priced. Had the chicken quesadillas as well as chicken tacos were delicious.

But best part was, on my way out one of the great gentlemans working their pull me aside for a shot of tequila with him on the house‚Ä¶ how good! Would recommend to everyone local or tourist!

My family and I had such a wonderful experience when we all stopped by for some delicious tacos! It was the best New York taco I‚Äôve ever had! (And I just moved here from Houston TX so I know my tacos)! The waiter literally made our day. He wasn‚Äôt rushed and made us just feel really taken care of which is something we all needed to feel as a family as all of our family who would normally be helping right now is back in Texas. My husband Ken just finished his last chemotherapy treatment two days ago, and he has been in unimaginable pain on and off for months. I‚Äôd have to say the atmosphere, the food and most importantly, the service made him feel so loved. We will be back!

Tried and true joint, long-standing and popular, one of the prides of Franklin Avenue. Good menu, friendly service, hits the mark. Brunch menu very popular; dinner menu also has a potent range of dishes for all palates. Good overall value‚Ä¶

Please do yourself a favor and try the crab tostada because that was the best crab dish I may have ever had in my life. Be sure to try the guacamole as well - it‚Äôs extremely fresh!

I can‚Äôt remember my server‚Äôs name unfortunately (I think Cassandra? Taller with long hair), but she was so amazing. Very attentive and hospitable, as were the other staff.

Definitely will be back with friends. Lucky to have this in Crown Heights!

This was my second time coming here. The first was for dinner and we dined indoors. The ambiance was nice. I like the decor and the intricate look of the ceilings. The food was tasty. I had enchiladas which was a good portion. The drink tasted strong. The second visit was for brunch/lunch. I was surprised how packed the place was; good for indoor and outdoor dining, but the outdoor was enclosed, which I don't mind since it was cold out. I had this non-egg platter (vegetarian) and it was delicious. Very appealing to the eyes and taste buds. The drink I ordered was strong, but perhaps my selection wasn't to my liking although it was recommended. I would come back here.

Liked very much their dishes especially beef fajitas and the beans - it was well made.
It is a nice place to enjoy a good meal with the colorful decorations. The service was great.

A great spot for Mexican cuisine where you won‚Äôt go wrong with any option. Came here with a large group of people and was able to get seated after 10 minutes or so. The restaurant was packed and service was a bit rushed - we felt like we‚Ä¶

A tad bit busy on a weekend night so we sat outside under the heat lamp. It was warm and toasted and the food came relatively quickly. Portions were good and service was friendly. Guac and chips was ok, I only little bits of appetizers, and‚Ä¶

Chavela's was amazing! From the moment we walked in the staff was super friendly and professional. We had about 8 people in our party but didn't have to wait for more than 5 minutes to get a table. The drinks were made just right (I had a strawberry margarita).

The food was exceptional! Definitely more of an adult dining experience though. We had 2 girls (10 years old) with us and they didn't seem too excited about anything on the menu. We ended up getting them french toast and quesadillas which they did enjoy.

The inside of the restaurant is absolutely gorgeous. Would def go back again.
Our new favorite Mexican place in the city. Went for brunch on Sunday and it was all perfect. Delicious authentic food. Pleasant environment and super nice, efficient service. We will be back.

Food was amazing. The wait time was about 30-40 mins (we did not have reservations). It was pretty busy on a Saturday around 630pm. They have outdoor seating. My group sat inside. We order the corn & guacamole for appetizers. Both were absolutely delicious. For the main We ordered the Don Plato which comes with chicken and steak and my husband got the short ribs with mole sauce. Both did not disappoint. Definitely will be coming back for the excellent service and food. Drinks were also very good. I ordered the strawberry margarita.

The outside was bright and welcoming with sitting outside.  It was quiet inside, I was there before 12pm.  Inside was decorated with beautiful glass butterflies . The staff was fabulous, especially my sever Jorge. I ordered the chicken taco.  The services was fast eventhough I only ordered 1 Taco.  It was one of the fresh and delicious taco I have eaten. I was pressed for time and could not enjoy the atmosphere but will be going back.  I definitely recommend this place for a quick bite or a full course meal.  Enjoy..

We ran out for a quick bite and ended up at Chavela‚Äôs. They took us even though they were crowded and we did not make reservations! Make reservations!

Staff was very friendly and helped us find things on the menu that we could eat. I am vegetarian. Waiter literally pulled up pictures of items on his phone to show us. Very amazing.

Quick service and exclusive staff. We sat outside under a heater. Which turned out better than I thought. Very warm and cozy. Must go back and sit inside next time .

It is worth the wait every time! I love guacamole but the smoke trout guacamole is my all time favorite. They have this very flavorful pepper/hot sauce that I enjoy every time.  One drop goes a long way. The specials are always on point. It's always lively but also feels intimate at the same time. Staff is friendly and on point with service.  Food is always at the appropriate temp. Drinks are amazing.

Was lucky enough to check out Chavela‚Äôs for a weekday lunch, there was still quite a few people dining. Service was kind and attentive. The decor is fantastic, bright colors and artifacts, a beautiful bar. I had the tortilla soup (delicious and so, so spicy for me!) a tamale and the mole and fish tacos. All were delicious, the tacos were definitely the stand out. Would recommend both the mole and pescado, I want to go back to try more. I didn‚Äôt feel rushed or hurried out. A great dining experience.

Chavela's is outstanding! I went on a Sunday evening with a party of three and was seated on the patio within 10 minutes. Our server was so friendly and thoughtful and our food came out super quickly! The bottle of sangria was a great deal and we all loved our food. My favorites were the smoked trout guacamole and Aurelia's mole which had such subtle flavors. Will definitely be back!
Wonderful cozy Mexican eatery in the heart of Brooklyn.  The menu is extensive with some great seafood options.  Definitely will try the micheladas next time !
